They comped the bagel.  Too many other really good places in the area to go back there.
Been over an hour and still no delivery. Called them and they said they already came by. Clearly they had not. I definitely wouldn't try them again.

Very rude manger, prices are exaggerated...been going there for 2 years. Food is a hit or miss. Never taste the same. Plus the min credit card purchase of 5 dollars even after i just purchased  $25 worth of food, the Manger would take my card when i wanted  to add a $2 item. I prefer Salem's will never go back to zeekos

If you're into soggy pizza where the cheese and toppings literally slide off the dough  then this place is for you!!  Very disappointed. Should have known the moment they delivered 20 minutes after I placed my order over the phone... It takes at least 20 minutes to cook a pizza.
Clam chowder tasted like it was from a can, old crab meat and re-cooked corn on the cob. Oh, and dirty bathroom.

Awful. My advice is do not order from here. Asked for well done pizza and received half cooked dough and runny toppings. Pizza was cold in the middle and bread sticks not even room temperature. I would suggest papa johns a mile down the road and avoid this joint at all costs.
Terrible service. And they didnt even care. The food was just so so. Train your wait staff so they know the menu

Still terrible. I had a late breakfast here and did not even have to wait. I still disliked my food and thought the prices were outrageous. Home fries are still delicious. Pancakes are still garbage. $3 plastic sausages are garbage. Service is still garbage. 

About the service. I ordered grits with cheese with my pancakes, sausage and home fries.. Do not order the grits with cheese. The "cheese" is a piece of Kraft American cheese cut up with a knife and put in a lump below your grits. The grits aren't even hot enough to melt the cheese fully and it is disgusting. The grits themselves are OK, but the cheese absolutely sucks and it costs extra.

Anyhow, I got my grits and my waitress said, "Check to see if there's cheese in there". So I put my fork in there and mixed around the grits. I did not see cheese. She said, "oh, sorry, I mixed this one up." So she picks up my grits, walks over three tables and SERVES THEM THE GRITS THAT I HAD JUST PLAYED WITH. She then picked up a bowl of grits FROM THEIR TABLE and gave it to me. Not exactly like sneezing into something and serving it to me, but damn close. 

Just go to IHOP. It's the same thing but so much cheaper.

Keeping the review short - 
Ingredients - good quality, freshly made (except the fried stuff)
Service - attentive, by the one actual *server* (not the helpers)
Presentation - down he dump
Preparation - down the dump
Everyone's order was getting screwed up. Ours was as well; the hot stuff was cold, the cold stuff was warm. 
Was crowded - Sunday brunch. But they were open for the capacity.. Their issue.
I was disappointed, with their quality.

I assume this following bit - they might be a fantastic place when it's not this crowded

So utterly upset with this place. Never before has an establishment aggravated me so. It is a 90 minute wait to get in. They said we will call you when table ready. We got in after 1 hr wait. During that hour we sat in a hot entry way with a squeaky door..no air condition with weather in hot humid 90s. After 45 mins, I ordered coffee from walk up bar.  They got it wrong..has to wait to remake. There was water pooled up in front of coffee station..no one was mopping it. Finally get seated outside counter. We gave order right away because we wanted to check in at our hotel and enjoy some pool time.  We waited, waited, waited..after 1 hour we asked for manager...They finally brought food like 1p min later. The manager was nice, took 25% off..gave us coupons for next time but we won't be back. Our server gave us tude when she brought bill and upon our leaving. I normally do not complain but although the food is supposed to be part of Nashville's finest, the management here is severely lacking to keep up with demand. Tgey also should afford air condition. We finally got to our hotel pool at our $400 a night hotel at 3p because of this place. Thanks Milk & Honey for ruining a huge part of our Nashville vacation.

Wow.. Haven't had sushi this bad in a long time.

We got take out and ended up throwing most of it out. Much of the fish was extremely fishy and inedible. We ordered an octopus dumpling appetizer that was dense and mushy. The octopus itself had a strange flavor. 

Highly disappointed. Especially given all the positive reviews. Although north Tampa is probably the worst place for food I've in the country. Im from the midwest; NO COMPARISON.

I will never eat nor order takeout from this establishment again! This restaurant is walking distance from my office so after having ordered takeout several times before some colleagues and I decided to walk over and dine in since the weather was so nice. Big mistake! We barely sat down before being asked for our orders, when told we needed more time the waiter rolled his eyes at us and walked away. He proceeded to be curt with is throughout the duration of our meals. Never once were we offered refills on drinks, our plates were not cleared upon finishing and one of my colleagues had to ask for a takeout container 3 times. To top it off the cashier was taking phone orders, seating guests and ringing up the checks at the same time. I get that it was during the lunch rush but there is no excuse for rude behavior when I am spending money in your establishment. Hire more help! I will not spend another dime here!

I've never thought Fulin's was that bad...until today.   
The menu's are DISGUSTINGLY sticky and in need of wiping down.   The window by table looks like two year olds rubbed their dirty hands all over it.   Our waitress attire looks like she never washes it...by the way she's served us before with dirty clothing so it's her mojo.  The first two sushi's were okay but something seemed to be lacking in taste and the presentation was... nothing...usually sushi is presented quite beautifully.  
But we ate it and wondered if we were ruined since we had sushi at a new place in Murfreesboro that was over the TOP delicious and fresh.   So we went on and ordered a third sushi.   The waitress served us the third sushi with the oddest hesitation...the sushi looked awful.  The menu never said the seaweed paper was on the outside.  It said it was served with avocado and one tiny piece of avocado was on ONE slice.  It was suppose to have Roe and it was nowhere to be found.  So we got the menu and proceeded to complain to the waitress as we felt it wasn't clearly explained what we were getting.  I honestly now wonder if the other two sushi's were even prepared correctly.   I had tasted one bite of the scallops sprinkled over the top and it was sooooooo dried out and disgusting.   My husband tried a slice of the roll.  He doesn't like seaweed on the outside to begin with but he said he's had better at the grocery stores (which is usually very bad).  So that's how low this place has gone.   Fulin's need a serious makeover and management that wants to serve good food.   You've lost two customers.

We came here because it was dog friendly.  I thought that was pretty cool and wanted to try it and also I can bring my four legged son. But it was all down hill from moment we sat down. Associates are not friendly it took 10 or so to get our first round of drinks. My dog didn't even get water til we asked. When we finally got our food our drink was half way gone and waiter didn't even ask if we wanted a refill.  So we waited and no one came to check on us. My husband actually called the restaurant ask for a manager and said we needed a refill and our waiter hasn't come to do refill it. Manager Amy apologizes and finally our drinks came. Waiter didn't even apologize and just hands it out.  Some people just have no customer service skills and shouldn't work where u have to interact with customers.
we did not even get to food .The first four plates on buffet were filthy with food remains.Never go there again doesn't even deserve one star

Great location, we've been going there for years, used to be a tradition to take visitors from all over up for a visit. Not anymore... SUNNI the bartender is seriously unstable, she rants & raves & screams at folks on a regular basis. Scary & very unprofessional. Beware

I'm shocked that anyone has ever given this dump a positive review. 

First, the seating is limited. There are only a few booths and half of them are jammed together. I really don't need to hear the conversations of everyone in the joint. 

Second, the service sucks. I don't know where my waitress was from but she needs to go back to the hole from which she emerged. One would think that in this recession, a person would be happy to be employed and do their very best. Not here! 


Third, the place is just plain dirty. I ended up walking out and probably saved myself an ulcer! 

Where is my hand sanitizer?!!!

-1 star literally the worst experience. The staff was okay but I got my coffee and it was terrible. My friend paid $10 for a tiny apple juice and a shitty milkshake that somehow tasted like chalk and she took two sips out of. It was ridiculous. We actually canceled our order to go to Cajun kitchen because it was just the worst. How do you mess up coffee so bad that I have to leave? Never ever go here it was awful.
This is a restaurant. The food was ok, the service was incredibly slow. This is not a place I would expect to spend two hours at.
I waited half an hour in a drive thru that traps you in. When I finally got to the window I got no apology and a bag of cold tacos.
I ordered carne Asada plate and went I paid I told the cashiers super fries is not my order and when I got home I got wrong order..not happy

The pizza tasted great going down , the crust was great, and the price was right,. My husband got the bbq chicken and it was weird. I ordered the one with ricotta and it was straight up wrong. My husband was sick all night and I spent the night barfing up tomato and ricotta which comes out your mouth like cottage cheese. Never again.
 AVOID THIS PLACE!

Ok, so DQ's food is pretty on point for fast food but there service just straight up stinks.  I order chicken fingers and they asked if I would like to make it a combo, I advised no since I only drink water.  I asked for a water cup and they gave me a 4 oz cup, maybe 6 oz, literally it was the size of the swish and spit cups at a dentist office, I thought it was a joke but it was not.  I was required to get a the cup for an extra buck, rather than having to go back to the drink station four or five times.  I wonder if Dairy Queen thinks the potential loss of $.20 cents in merchandise (cup and if I was trying to put the screws to them and get a soda) is worth a customer leaving with a negative feeling?  I will go back to DQ but I will avoid this one for sure.

well over-priced. 15% gratuity for 5 people ( family with 3 kids ). paid $200. $30 gratuity. We still had to go to tim horton's for donut coz we were still hungry. Most of their sushi has the same spicy taste and prawn tempura was a size of a shrimp. terrible...i would never go back there.

Came in today and set a wait list reservation and they said it would be about 10-15 minutes. An hour later still no text back and brunch plans ruined...ended taking my girl to chipotle.  Disappointing experience.

I do not recommend. Walking in we were not greeted asked only "how many". The customer service was horrible. Forgot drink orders. Was mopping the floor 2 hrs prior to close all around all the people that were eating. My opinion  I don't like to eat and smell bleach all around me.  The food was OK but no one came to ask how anything was or follow up. I would not go back

I have stopped by a few times since moving into Rittenhouse Square looking for a friendly pub. In my first two visits during the Spring, the bartenders were nice, friendly and welcoming. This past Fall and Winter, the staff made me feel like an imposition. They were more content sitting/standing on the side of the bar talking about their days and nights and, dare I mention, making fun of customers rather than acknowledging paying attention to the bar of customers. One gentlemen had to ask numerous times to pay his tab (it was not busy). This was my last try at The Black Sheep and will stay with Twenty Manning Grill.
